wikipedia_page.main: General Sir George Digby Barker  (Chinese Translated Name: 白加; 9 October 1833 – 15 April 1914) was a British soldier and colonial administrator.

response: *George Digby Barker (1833–1914), British soldier and colonial administrator
*Barker Road. Located on Barker Road, named after George Digby Barker, a former military commander and acting administrator of Hong Kong.
*George Digby Barker (1833–1914), British soldier and colonial administrator
*1911–1914: Gen. Sir George Digby Barker, GCB
# 1896–1901: Lt. Gen. Sir George Digby Barker, 78th (Highlanders) Regiment of Foot (or The Ross-shire Buffs)

Constructed in 1914, the building was officially opened on 12September 1916 by Lady May, daughter of Lieutenant General George Digby Barker, British Commanding Officer in China and Hong Kong from 1890 to 1895, as a respite for unaccompanied women arriving in Hong Kong. In 1891, Helena Barker married Sir Francis Henry May, who would become Governor of Hong Kong in 1912.
*1905–1911: Gen. Sir George Digby Barker, GCB
* General Sir George Digby Barker, , Colonel, Seaforth Highlanders (Ross-shire Buffs, The Duke of Albany's).
* Lieutenant-General George Digby Barker, , Governor and Commander-in-Chief, Bermuda.

response: The road was named after George Digby Barker, a former military commander and acting administrator of Hong Kong between May and December 1891.
